In the complex of tail and dryness, there is matter that will be dried out; some argue that cautery should be used with this kind, while others contend against it, stating that cautery isn't suitable for illness in terms of quality and dryness. And know, children, that concerning the secret of healing through cautery with fire and the goodness thereof, there is a burning medicine for cautery; as fire is simple, its action only affects the member being cauterized and does not spread to other parts unless it's adjusted very slightly with minor harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit. The fire, due to its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do this except that it overflows. E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree about the time when it's best to perform cautery and choose the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is convenient at all times; because the harm due to accidental time lapses is submerged in the youth of what was subjected to cautery, and especially if cautery is for pain or necessary pains, strong aches and swellings, which do not tolerate delays as feared by those who might suffer from malice, which is greater than minor harm occurring over time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this does not concern your understanding or, children, those who only value the common people and laymen doctors, for it's that when an illness is healed with cautery, it doesn't warrant doing so at all times, thus they refrain from such actions.

E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it's possible that its illness may return at some point in time, according to the composition of the illness and the location of the patient's ailment, as well as its virtue, and what is prepared within their body due to the accumulation of excesses, and what they consume or are exposed to from those causes; otherwise, if cautery was applied to an illness, it might have been a subtle illness with few excesses and humidity. Thus, it's possible that such pain doesn't recur in them, but rather, actions like this occur gradually.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	A common medical term is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it's a professional term, not something I understand from them, as they believe it's not a cure that improves through medicine or any other cause leading to cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is contrary to that; and I understand that cautery is the last remedy of medicine but it's only when administering the methods of treatment in some diseases, and those medicines don't work, then at the end of the cause, one administers cautery, improving towards that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here, it's clear that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to my understanding which aligns with common beliefs among doctors and many people.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia. And they would say that the location of cautery doesn't cause pain, but this isn't absolutely true, for I have already tested it and found that it doesn't do this in most cases, rather when using a metal rod. Cautery with gold is good and better than iron as they claim; however, yet when you apply cautery over fire with gold, it's not as described, as it melts according to the amount of gold desired for its heat, and one needs to prepare to receive the flame. And if you adjust it on the flame, then the gold melts in the fire, and sometimes a few layers are produced so that the craftsman can work based on the shape of that metal piece.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, when doing cautery with iron, you should do it more lightly and more precisely according to the nature of the operation.

De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Regarding cautery for headache due to coldness and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery treatment involves applying heat to the head and neck area as a remedy for humidity and coldness causing various inflammatory reactions such as swelling in the joints, head movement disorders, and symptoms like fluid flow from the ears and throat, sleep disturbances, tooth pain, and stomach discomfort. It is universally effective against any illness caused by coldness, whether it manifests as paralysis, edema or stroke, and seems similar to those conditions.

The method of this cautery is as follows: initially instruct the patient to take a restorative medicine on their head, either for three or four nights, according to what suits the patient's condition and age, and their usual practice.

E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then put your palm's edge close to the nose tip between their ears.

E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the marked spot on the test area in such a way that it descends slowly, ensuring your hand is slightly constricted gradually, and you rotate it.

And then raise your hand slightly and observe the spot. E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on that spot, leaving it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your heated finger over the spot and leave it until the burnt skin is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with tetrathymol ointment until it heals.

E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they expect from that area the release of vapor from the head.

Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura. Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the nose becomes softened due to disease or moisture, then apply that eyelid with this moon-based cautery; and this is how you should do it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that above both eyebrows slightly between two points in all parts, and make them extend up to the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard on your hand at the cautery, rather according to how much of the inner eyelid is heated.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cautery of the eyelid when the skin is converted to parts inside and around the hand.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eyelid is converted to parts inside and around it, when I touch the eyelid, I do the cautery in two ways, which type of cautery or whether with medicine that burns.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If it's a cautery you're performing with fire, instruct the patient in front of this so that they feel their skin as those who are being shaved do, let them be extended and made equal; and if you hold onto that place, then strengthen the eyelids with your hand so that they don't get burned when their hair grows back under their skin.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	So when they are grown and made equal, then place the patient's head on your shoulder, and over the eyelid of their eyes apply a tentative touch, mark the one according to the shape of a maple leaf, and make the start of the mark near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And place about a pinch in beaten egg white or pus from scabies on the eyelid.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And apply heat to the cautery of which this is its form for you.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And apply the cautery to the figure which you marked, little by little in spots seen, while burning the surface of the skin that is like a maple leaf, altogether appearing quite precisely.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And as a sign of your work's health is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of it raised above the point of the eyelid.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave that for three days, and place over it a pinch inside so that the scar is raised.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And place healing balm on it while it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	And if for any reason returns the hair at their origin and the eyelid becomes soft, then do another layer of cautery over that just as you did first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	And if the hairs are on the eyelid remaining, then cauterize that until it rises to its natural place and is made equal so that the hairs do not burn the eyelid.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to feel their skin until it's extended and made equal, and then have done on linen cloth the shape of a maple leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take some well-known soap and a live ash stick. .1., o does this, and mix those ashes well in water; do it quickly so that it doesn't cool down. Then spread this over the linen cloth made as a maple leaf shape, place this on one eyelid or both; put a pinch of beaten egg white on this, and have the patient's head on your shoulder.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the same on the medicine and press that gently but don't burn it while the patient feels the sensation of the medicine's bite, which bite is in them as if from fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when this persistent biting sensation continues, then feel the medicine and remove it from your shoulder; once this biting sensation ceases, then again apply the medicine by washing it off with water; then consider if the eyelid has already risen as if washed of its scabs by fire or incision, which is now done. And if it doesn't return to that place on the spot where you applied the medicine and doesn't disappear until your operation is equalized and the eyelid is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place over it a pinch inside until the scar of the adjustment is eradicated, and afterwards treat that with ointment or another while it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And for this, you must keep watch over your operation with diligence so that no part of the medicine falls into the eyelid. If the eyelid softens after some days and any hair causes burn in the eyelid, then apply your medicine to that place on the eyelid which has softened, precisely like you did at the beginning, and surround it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the shape of a maple leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that men's eyelids vary according to their size and thickness, thus according to this you will perform your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let there be no concealment of the path to rectitude towards that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery for a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with what we've discussed in the divisions of illnesses and don't apply your treatment, then you should perform this method when cauterizing it: command the patient to place their head on your shoulder, and have one of their servants between your hands in such a way that neither their head is burned nor disturbed under their own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And place heat in an oil bath or on fat over their stomach.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And apply the hot cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which should be heated, like when it takes the shape of a cane or a goose quill pen, from one end where the cautery is applied.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, it should penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out like when it is tested.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the heated one is better for the country's work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And if there is an abscess, press it if it has opened, and cleanse him of it and dry that area.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it hasn't opened, then open it and remove the pus from him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And apply over him the heated cautery which should be very hot, and hold it to his stomach until your hand or the patient doesn't get agitated, then leave the cautery on the gray area of the stomach and let that one cool down.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the mouth, it's good; otherwise, then reapply the cautery once or twice if needed; and leave that one for three days, then apply a heated point around it and inside him apply an exsiccating oil to heal him.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	And if it has passed ten days and he is not healed, then apply the sharp corrosive medicine inside where the bone appears and scrape him according to what seems appropriate in his manual.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another method for the cautery of an abscess that some initially described: go to the place of the abscess and open it up and apply there a fine line of what is like him, And then put in that place half a unit of melted lead; and hold your hand firmly, so you don't hurt the patient because the melted lead doesn't penetrate into his stomach; and when you hold over the stomach of the patient heat as if immersed in oil bath or water, where the lead adheres to the abscess site and heals it through a miraculous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the abscess is healed as we've said about the cautery and the cure, it's good; otherwise, then it's necessary to administer through the nose and reduce the abscess to the body of the nose according to where it naturally fits.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery of the fissure in the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Red spots often occur on fissures in the lips, and especially in the lips of children.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery of abscesses in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the uvula or on the palate or in the back of the throat there's pus and you feel warmth, then it bursts, heals old wounds, you bleed them, and form an abscess; when this happens, you should treat that without deepening the treatment, then take the cautery until its heat reaches inside the abscess cavity, place the heated part in the mouth of the abscess canal, and hold your hand so that the heat of the fire penetrates to its root, do it once or twice; then cure that with what we have told you about healing until he is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so, if the healing has been removed and he is healed, it's good; otherwise, then it's necessary to find the location and extract the infected bone according to what seems appropriate in its manual.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cautery of teeth and the alleviation of mucous membranes.

When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are painful, if you treat those with medicines and do not apply hot substances, then hold the patient's head in its usual position, and heat up the cautery according to what will be roughly similar for this task. E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and reapply the cautery a few times according to what you desire.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc. Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Applying heat on cow's sides involves taking cow's horns and heating them in iron, then taking a point and wrap it around the end of the horn, immerse that heated point into hot water, and hold that over the painful tooth until it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then iterate that several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.

Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	May however be cautious with the use of fire in cauterization, wait for the smell of flesh or iron, and if there's any pus or infection in the patient's body, ensure that the heat of the fire doesn't reach inside the tooth cavity.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia. E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply heat to whatever you see is extreme, according to what is possible for you.
